title: Organization Relationships Schema
description: The organization's connections to other entities in the world, defining its political position and network of influence.

organization_id.description: Reference to another organization with which this group maintains positive relations.

relationship_type.description: The nature of cooperation between these organizations, indicating the foundation of their relationship and reciprocal obligations.

strength.description: The current stability and reliability of this alliance, indicating how likely it is to endure under pressure or competing interests.

public_knowledge.description: Whether this alliance is openly acknowledged or kept secret from the general population and other organizations.

allies.description: Organizations with which this group maintains positive relationships, cooperation, or formal alliances.

organization_id.description: Reference to another organization with which this group has conflict or competition.

conflict_type.description: The fundamental source of tension between these organizations, defining the nature of their opposition and potential resolution paths.

intensity.description: The current severity of hostilities between the organizations, indicating the methods and tactics employed in their conflict.

rivals.description: Organizations with which this group has conflict, competition, or outright enmity.

public_perception.description: How the common populace generally views this organization, affecting its ability to operate openly and recruit new members.

elite_perception.description: How the ruling class, nobility, or other power centers view this organization, influencing its political leverage and access to resources.

general_reputation.description: The overall standing and reputation of this organization among different segments of society.
